page.title: 14USE OF THE LAND
page.content: Below the tree line the area was originally woodland.From our study we observed that on the valley sides this is still the case,but the land above 80m has been cleared and used for agri culture.This must have originally occured over two hundred years ago.The "Cilshafe" group of farms (97 36)are known to be over two hundred years old.Llanwern farm (97 34)is also known to be of a similar age.The pattern of the fields as seen from map evidence and observation was found to be one of fairly small paddock type pastures which have altered little over the past centuries as the original dry stone walls now covered with vegetation,still exist.We found that the large fields were used for cereal growing whilst the smaller paddocks were used as nursery paddocks especially during lambing time.
